intro: Agalmyla biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces two flowers per inflorescence, which is a distinctive feature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
